Uses of Class
javax.swing.JMenu

  • Packages that use JMenu 
    Package Description
    javax.swing
    Provides a set of "lightweight" (all-Java language) components that, to the maximum degree possible, work the same on all platforms.
    javax.swing.plaf.basic
    Provides user interface objects built according to the Basic look and feel.
    javax.swing.plaf.metal
    Provides user interface objects built according to the Java look and feel (once codenamed Metal), which is the default look and feel.

    • Uses of JMenu in javax.swing

      Methods in javax.swing that return JMenu 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JMenu JMenuBar.add(JMenu c)
      Appends the specified menu to the end of the menu bar.
      JMenu JMenuBar.getHelpMenu()
      Gets the help menu for the menu bar.
      JMenu JMenuBar.getMenu(int index)
      Returns the menu at the specified position in the menu bar.
      Methods in javax.swing with parameters of type JMenu 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JMenu JMenuBar.add(JMenu c)
      Appends the specified menu to the end of the menu bar.
      void JMenuBar.setHelpMenu(JMenu menu)
      Sets the help menu that appears when the user selects the "help" option in the menu bar.
